comment: one of the best profs i've had! he's very knowledgable in economics, gives great examples that help you understand the concepts better, and gives quizzes and exams in similar formats so it all flows together. took him for an honors course, would take his class again in a heartbeat!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: One of my favorite Professors! Great lectures and responds to emails quickly. No busywork.
VERY SIMPLE AND EASY ONLINE CLASS. CONSISTED OF A COUPLE TEST AND QUIZZES AND THAT'S IT. VERY STRAIGHTFOWARD AND TAKE HIM FOR AN EASY A.

This Prof. was AMAZING. He would go the extra mile to make sure you understood the material and would do his best to give examples for each topic. He gives you 4 exams and drops your lowest score. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Honestly a great class, no homework. 3 open note quizzes that is worth 30 percent of your grad total. 4 tests, drops your lowest. Easy A, take him if you hate hw, and want to just get to the point of learning the material. In person, paper/pencil tests, so people can't cheat. You'll actually learn the material, wish more professors did this tbh.

Good professor, personable and explains things well. Prof. provides slides and material on D2L making it easier to study for exams. There isn't much homework, or quizzes so make your exam grades count.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: To pass this class you do not need to attend class however you do have to dilligently read and take notes on lecture slides. do the chapter quizzes and the practice test and you will do well. He's very funny, and willing to answer questions. You do have to put in the work to do well.
He cares about what he teaches and tries to make the lectures engaging. He has open-note quizzes which also have two attempts. The exams are difficult and it is on paper during class.
bn mn.,km   nm,k nn

The class is quiz and test heavy so if you struggle in that environment I'd avoid it. He doesn't hand out extra credit either so keep that in mind. The exams are super similar to the practice quizzes he post and he sometimes would pull questions from them. Attendance isn't mandatory but helps. His grading is also super forgiving.

This was one of my first classes back after taking a extended break from school, the class was online and he provide great material for review, all test were related to the information during the class, no hidden surprises, lectures were pre-recorded and walked through the weekly assignments. I would recommend him for ECON1000.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Overall, he's really good. But he's much better with a smaller and more active class. He taught the honors section of this this semester and I actually was looking forward to his class. All of the questions on his exams and tests are essentially the practice questions. As long as you try just a bit and actually spend time, you're golden with him.
His lectures are so boring and all tests are in person as of this semester. Why can't there be other assignments other than the quizzes and tests??

I just want to start and saw any review that is not in 2024 is inaccurate. Test are no longer online and are vary difficult. Our class had a study group and even with that. Majority reviewed low grades on the test. There are no homework assignments to help balance out your grade. Be prepared to cry after every test
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Easy class. Just read slides, don't even need to read textbook. Only quizzes, exams, and paper were for grades. Quizzes have two attempts, the questions you get wrong on the first attempt are the only ones you need to answer again and you are given the correct answers after the first attempt. Just study the practice tests for the exams to get an A.

Professor Boudreau is probably too easy. I showed up to 6 classes the whole semester and was 1 of maybe 10 at most in an over 100 person class. Exams get harder as you go along so be sure to study the practice problems before, you will need to even if it doesn't appear so at first. Offers quizzes with multiple attempts before exams to prepare you.
Not sure if the lectures were actually from this Professor but it was good they were there. The covered the material exactly and were to the point.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Only graded by quizzes and tests. Very easy course, but he needs to work on correcting his syllabus, because it was not consistent with D2L. When the class tried to bring it up, he got very upset and was very rude to some of the students. Make sure you pay attention to D2L because his deadlines in syllabus are wack.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Easy class! All tests are online and no lockdown. You can either show up to class or not. I didn't go to class so that's why I got a B, if I went it would be an easy A.

Honestly it is my own fault that I got a B, I actually almost never went to the lectures. The lectures I did attend were long and kinda boring other than his hilarious comments he would occasionally throw in. If you want an easy class that you really do not need to show up to, this is your guy. He's honestly a really cool dude.

A little quirky but really knows his stuff. Graded by just a few things so the workload is light and he drops the lowest test. Some of these reviews accusing uncomfortable and off-topic rants are heavily inflated. I found his lectures to be very interesting.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a good professor. The textbook and going to class weren't necessary. Watch the video lectures and write notes, answer the practice questions he provides and you'll do great. If you're cool with teaching yourself, then this is the class for you. 4 tests (90% of your grade, the lowest grade is dropped) and 3 quizzes (10% of your grade).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: At the beginning of the semester, the professor heavily implied that we should not purchase the textbook, which I did not. However, his lectures turned into to him going on disgruntled and literally incoherent rants to the point I and others would leave class. Felt very uncomfortable. I was left with no real lectures and no textbook.

He was evidently very unorganized and would go on tangents about interesting topics in his personal life. Its hard to write notes because he's all over the place so prepare to study for the tests. He never put in grades so I had no idea what to expect at the end of the semester. It was a mystery as to what I had in the class the entire semester.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 3 quizzes 4 tests he drops the lowest test. All open note no lockdown. A lot of reviews are mad that the tests arent on quizlet but if you study youll do fine cause they arent hard if you know what's going on.If you want a class where you can just quizlet everything then take someone else but if econ is easy or youll study then its a perfect class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: No lockdown browser for tests and quizzes. 4 tests and 3 quizzes(lowest test gets dropped). Would recommend taking if you want a light workload class
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Respected

comment: Odd guy, but really knows his stuff. Only thing I didn't like is how the grading is solely based off of three tests and three quizzes, although he does drop lowest exam grade. Take him at your discretion.

Had him for bio 140, you are only graded by test with questions that he does not go over and are also not based off of the text book. You really rely on the lab to pass the class. His slides that you take notes on are a minimum of 122 but they are not organized and dont hold information that would help you on the quizzes.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take him. He literally stopped coming to class and we had to change professors in the middle of semester.

At first he seemed like he was gonna be a easy teacher. He dismisses class early as 25 min and didnt ever wanna help students when they asked and was not passionate about his job. He often missed class with weird excuses and you only are graded by 3 tests which are impossible even though they are open not and unlimited timed.
Professor Boudreau provided all the materials needed to pass his class. Grade was based off 3 exams which he curved A LOT. & attendance was not mandatory. Didnt round my 89, though.
Professor Boudreau really is a great professor! I had him for my first Econ class at KSU for my first semester and I loved him!
I recommend this professor because its any easy A and he wants you to succeed.

did not like this class one bit. each chapter presentation is at least 30 slides long with only paragraphs and graphs that are not clear. he doesnt make his own notes and uses his friends book to guide the class. His tests are unreasonably hard and even if you go to class and have knowledge of economics youre still screwed. dont take him
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Graded by three tests. LOOK OVER the PowerPoints, handouts, and practice questions, and you'll be fine. Attendance isn't mandatory, and the class is easy enough that you could teach yourself. He doesn't take long to respond to emails if you need help. Some of his test questions could be worded a bit better, but overall they're fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I personally do not understand how can you not pass his class. Tests are open book and fairly easy. He does not give extra credit but always gives extra points in the exams, enough to bump you a letter grade. An easy-going professor for a very easy course. If you have just a little common sense you can get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: This is hands down the worst professor I've ever had! At first I thought this class was going to be an easy A. Even bragged to some friends about it. But there are only 3 tests and he literally DOES NOT teach. When asked to create extra credit he said it would be too much work for him when there are literally only 3 tests as grades . TERRIBLE.

Professor Boudreau SEEMED like a very chill professor at the beginning of the Fall Semester at Kennesaw. Throughout this semester he deemed all of his material & classwork can be finished online so coming to class wasn't mandatory but only has his ENTIRE class carried by 4 TESTS! Even when attending or using notes they were USELESS! Horrible & lazy

Atrocious. Only takes 3 tests as a grade the whole semester. Not only that students have to learn by themselves outside of class. Almost all students have hard times taking the exams in the class and he doesnt really help because he doesnt care about your grades.

This was the worst class i have ever taken. 3 tests determine your whole letter grade (30%, 30%, 40%) & theres no extra credit to bring your grade up if you fail one of the tests. he doesnt explain or teach the content in class & he doesnt care about students either. DO NOT TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He could be one the worst professors at Kennesaw. He has 3 test. The questions on his exams make no kind of sense. Most everyone in the class has failed them. Someone asked about extra credit opportunity and he said no because "it would be too much work". He literally gives three test. Which grade themselves. Don't take him if you rely on HOPE.
Awful teacher and didnt seem to care about students grades or helping the students pass the class

He barely taught in class, only the "important things" so we had to teach ourselves the rest. He continuously cancelled class the morning of instead of emailing us. He never emailed us about anything either. The only good thing is that he made our tests available for a week.
He did not show up for most of the semester, but it was of most easiest courses that I have taken!! Recommended!
Literally never showed up to class and got an A. No lockdown browser on tests etc.
Best Econ Professor!!
Take him, you won't regret your decision!
This is a super easy econ course, but I do recommend reading your notes before the test!

Professor Boudreau really is a great professor! I had him for my first Econ class at KSU for my first semester and I loved him! His tests are just like the practice questions and everything is very clear and organized! 10/10

Dr. Boudreau is a great guy. He made class optional due to Covid, but he's very responsive via email. There are 4 tests, lowest is dropped and the highest exam grade worth 40% with the others being 30%. Tests are not too hard. He sends out practice questions and answers. Sometimes they are the exact same on the test. I really enjoyed his class.

Taken during COVID, Dr. Boudreau made his class as easy/student-friendly as possible. Online pre-recorded lectures and practice questions (with answers) for each chapter, with three exams and a cumulative final, all open note/book. I never stressed while taking his class, which was great. If you fairly understand economics, you should be fine.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: No other assignments besides the tests. But as long as your practice and do the practice questions for the exam you will pass. Exams are not lockdown or webcam. He also lets you use your notes on the tests. Really fun, and breaks down the material in a clear understanding. Really enjoyed his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: His tests are very similar to the practice he gives, which made the test easy but can kinda trip you up. Didn't really go to class and he is a cool dude.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Boudreau was an extremely EASY professor. I would say this though, his lectures are absolutely awful. Because of this, I only showed up a few times. You will have to study alot for his class, but it was easy. His practice questions, in most instances, are IDENTICAL to the test questions.
Don't even think about taking another professor. This is the best Econ class you can take. Very very easy with 4 tests. No homework and does not take attendance. He's a very nice guy!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Fun professor who is very knowledgeable and claims he can be a good teacher when he tries. That's the issue... he didn't. You can get an easy A but if you care about economics or want to learn something you probably wont. I needed the A so I took him and I would do it again but he made me almost switch majors away from economics.

A super chill dude and really funny too. Final grade is made up of 3 exams and the highest test score he gives you the highest weight of the test. He also sometimes gives out secret words for showing up to class. Attendance not mandatory. Tests are also practically identical to the practice questions he gives out. Really easy class to get an A in.

He gives out a review sheet and the test is made from those questions. Seems simple until you have to study 100+ questions. Does not cover the material well, you will not learn economics in this class. Seemed very confused about the final. You can memorize the questions and pass, but you wont learn anything. Gave out final review the day before.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Does not reply to emails at all. Makes you do extra credit activities but then you do not get credit for them. Says all the questions for the tests are on the study guides but they are not so study the power points. Does not take attendance but SOMETIMES gives extra credit for attendance. Very late grader. Overall a good guy but a hard class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Easy A if you study the review. Knowledgeable of the subject but he is well aware that most people aren't in his class to learn Econ - they're in his class because they have to be, and his lectures and test difficulty level reflect that. Study the reviews, pay just a little bit of attention in class, and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: EASY A. Don't take him if you want to actually learn something, but if you don't care at all about Econ: he doesn't either. Class is boring and no one really wants to be there- they're just there for the extra credit save for a few in front. Pretty much gives you a copy of the test before you take it. Do the questions and you'll ace the test.

EASY! All you have to do is read and do the practice test before each exam and youll pass. The question on his practice test are identical to his exams. Also your highest grade is worth 40% so if your final is your lowest grade it wont count as much. Incredibly easy course.

No textbook, no homework, no attendance taken. You have three exams and a final. For each exam he puts up review questions that are VERBATIM the same as the tests. Super easyyyy. Take him if you have to take this course.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: He is by far the most entertaining professor i have ever had and probally ever will have. He always jokes around and keep you interested. 4 test worth 30,30,40 as he drops the lowest and makes your best one worth 40. He dosnt care about attendance but will give u extra credit if if show up. Class is a guaranteed B if u dont try and A if you try
The class is literally 3 tests. And you get the entire test beforehand. Just memories the questions and answers and it will be the easiest A ever. GPA booster.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a really caring guy, and he's funny as well. His lectures are somewhat uninteresting, and you only have three tests, but if you use the study guides, you'll easily get an A or B.

You don't have to sweat it if you miss class, because it won't affect your grade at all. So, that's a plus. He also allows discussion in class, which helps me grasp topics better, even if I'm not the one talking. There are only 3 non-cumulative tests, and he gives you the test questions to study over before the test with answers to check your work.

Professor Boudreau is a real expert in economics, as he provides the best and most hilarious examples in his lectures. He will crack a joke about the class or himself every once in a while so be ready to laugh. He is very loud despite the fact that he is used to teaching in a small class setting, so listening to him is not hard. Awesome professor!

He makes econ fun to learn and does it in an upbeat and fun way. He's always cracking jokes and he's super passionate about what he's teaching. You only have 3 tests for the whole semester. Nothing else. Class isn't mandatory, but you won't want to miss it because he's super helpful and clear when teaching the material. Take him!!
rating_tags: Hilarious--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Such a good professor! Hes so funny and really laid back!
Legit a cool dude. Was definitely stressed because economics is not my favorite and his class was a breeze and he is a great professor!
I have no idea why people do not like him as a professor! Probably one of the best professors at Kennesaw. Makes Econ 1000 super easy, and he knows how to relay this information amazingly
A real gem, he made Econ a very fun subject for the whole class

This teacher is under rated. He is funny, knowledgeable, and is passionate about the material he teaches. I think the reason many people don't like him is because Econ is a difficult concept to understand throughly and if you don't put in the time to understand the subject you won't do well in the class.

Definitely the chillest professor! He is super funny and very relatable. Attendance is not mandatory, but I literally just show up for his jokes (and because he is just very passionate about econ). Three tests (takes the best score and makes it worth the highest percentage). Overall great guy, and I would definitely recommend him!!!!
Boudreau is very good and approachable. If you pay attention to the lectures you will make it okay
He is the best professor ever and so funny also you can tell he loves what he does.
He gets so much hate for zero reason! Probably the most relatable professor ever. If you want an easy A for econ, he is the way to go! There's no homework just three tests

I don't know why this poor man has such a terrible rating. Dr. Boudreau is so freaking cool. He has a great sense of humor and his class is not hard if you just show up. He doesn't take attendance and you don't need the textbook, how more easy does it need to be lol. I recommend you show up though because he'll be the chillest prof you've ever had
rating_tags: Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: He gets a lot of hate, but the class is actually fairly easy if you read the textbook and do the practice exercises. His lectures are informative (and funny, if you like gloomy humor). There are only three tests and very little extra credit, but if you do the work the tests aren't hard. Be sure to ask him for which chapters to read before lecture.
